newsitem.title: THAILAND: Export value of Jan-Feb Thai vehicles, parts up.
newsitem.headline: Export value of Jan-Feb Thai vehicles, parts up.

text.p: The export value of Thai assembled vehicles and parts jumped 84.7 percent to 3.2 billion baht ($123.07 million) in the first two months of the year from 1.75 billion baht in the same period last year, an industry association said on Wednesday.

The export value of cars and car parts during the January-February period jumped to two billion baht from 456 million in the same period a year ago, the Thai Automotive Industry Association said in a statement.
The value of motorcycles and motorcyle part exports in the period was down to 1.22 billion baht from 1.29 billion baht in the same period in the previous year, it said.
The total number of passenger cars and commercial vehicles assembled in Thailand in the first two months of 1997 was 80,858 units against 86,059 in the same period in 1996.
